modules.description: Converts between in-memory representations of shadow password entries and their structured data format. Works with `OPasswd.Shadow.t` and `OPasswd.Shadow.Mem.mem` types. Used to serialize and deserialize shadow password data for storage or transmission.

This module provides functions to access and manipulate user account information from the system's password database. It works with a structured type representing user entries, including fields like username, UID, GID, and shell, and supports operations such as lookup by name or UID, reading and writing entries to disk, and modifying the database. Concrete use cases include retrieving user details, updating password file entries, and synchronizing in-memory user data with persistent storage.

This module provides direct access to shadow password database entries, allowing applications to read, write, and manipulate user account security settings. It supports operations such as retrieving records by name or iterating through the database, and includes mechanisms to lock the shadow file for safe concurrent access. The integrated serialization submodule enables conversion between in-memory representations and structured data formats, facilitating storage and transmission of shadow entries. Example uses include enforcing password expiration policies, managing user login restrictions, and synchronizing authentication data across systems.

This module handles password retrieval, storage, and unshadowing operations. It works with string values to represent account identifiers and passwords. Concrete use cases include securely storing user credentials, retrieving passwords for authentication, and unshadowing passwords for system-wide access.

This module provides a comprehensive interface for managing user account information, shadow password entries, and credential handling. It supports structured types representing user data with fields like username, UID, GID, and shell, along with operations for lookup, modification, and synchronization with disk storage. The module enables secure password storage, retrieval, and unshadowing, and includes mechanisms for safe concurrent access to the shadow database. Example uses include enforcing password policies, updating user details, and synchronizing authentication data across systems.
